org.guicebox.failover
Class JavaPing

java.lang.Object
  org.guicebox.failover.JavaPing
All Implemented Interfaces:
Ping
@ThreadSafe
public final class JavaPing
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ping

Utility for pinging a specified network address. The wire protocol is implemented by InetAddress.isReachable(int).

Author:
willhains

Constructor Summary
JavaPing(java.lang.String wka, java.util.logging.Logger log)
          Prepares a ping to the specified well-known address (WKA).

Constructor Detail

JavaPing

public JavaPing(java.lang.String wka,
                java.util.logging.Logger log)
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Prepares a ping to the specified well-known address (WKA). Call start(PingListener) to start pinging.

Parameters:
wka - the host name or IP address of the ping target.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - if the specified host name could not be found in DNS.
Method Detail

start

public void start(PingListener pingListener)
Description copied from interface: Ping
Starts pinging the WellKnownAddress every PingInterval. Each time a response is received, the specified listener will get a PingListener.onPing() callback. If no response is received within PingInterval x PingTolerance, the specified listener will get a PingListener.onPingTimeout() callback.

Specified by:
start in interface Ping

stopPinging

public void stopPinging()
Description copied from interface: Ping
Temporarily stops pinging the WellKnownAddress.

Specified by:
stopPinging in interface Ping

stop

public void stop()
Description copied from interface: Ping
Permanently stops pinging the WellKnownAddress. The Ping cannot be used to test connectivity after calling this method. This method blocks until the internal ping thread is completely shut down, unless the calling thread is interrupted.

Specified by:
stop in interface Ping
